oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Solution of transport equations on unstructured meshes with cell-centered colocated variables. Part II: Applications
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PIMPALNERKAR, S
KULKARNI, M
DATE, AW
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: pressure-based method
heat-transfer
laminar-flow
natural-convection
benchmark problem
grids
tube
simple algorithm
unstructured meshes
cubic cavity
t-branch
twisted tape
nozzle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper describes applications of the discretization procedure presented in the companion paper [A.W. Date, Solution of transport equations on unstructured meshes with cell-centered colocated variables. Part I. Discretization, Companion Paper, this volume]. Six problems having different domain complexities, presence of body and surface forces and, boundary conditions are solved. Where possible, the solutions are compared with published experimental or numerical data. (C) 2004
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF HEAT AND MASS TRANSFER, 48(6), 1128-1136
